[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 180]
Reasoning: **The Calculated Gambit**

Okay, Ante 7, Round 16, pre-boss. I've got $25 and am facing "The Eye," which means no repeating hand types. My current Jokers are Smiley Face, Photograph, Hanging Chad, Stuntman, and Pareidolia. Plus, I have "The World," which can be situationally useful. I've got a High Card build. Pareidolia makes all cards face cards, which triggers Hanging Chad, which means my Photograph card (which doubles the face card), will retrigger. Smiley Face will get +5 mult 3 times. Stuntman gives a ton of chips and mult. My base score on a High Card is estimated at 70,800.

I'm eyeing the shop: Neptune is useless for me, but Swashbuckler gives +23 Mult based on joker sell value. Crazy and Sly Jokers aren't worth it. Is Swashbuckler worth replacing Smiley Face? Well, Swashbuckler is *slightly* better, but it will drop my cash below the optimal $25 to accrue interest.

The obvious play is to save money, since the shop is underwhelming, and prep for "The Eye." I need to beat the boss with non-repeating hands. High Card, Pair, and maybe Two Pair are my options. Since I'm doing 70k per High Card, I might need 2-3 hands, but the shop isn't worth a reroll. I'm going to save my money.

Re-evaluating the Joker order, I need to make sure I am getting the maximum benefit from retriggering. Smiley Face (Mult) *must* come before Photograph (X Mult). Otherwise, it becomes an awful return on my resources. With this order, my estimated Mult will be 120. Photograph + Chad + Smiley (20, 3 times = 60). I'm still debating on Swashbuckler: worth it or not worth it? It would be +6 Mult for $4. I'd be at 23, losing $1 in interest. But, since the boss is "The Eye," a more controlled approach may be best.

Given the non-repeating hand requirement, I'm confident I can win "The Eye." If I use High Card followed by Pair, that's ~137k. Given the previous Big Blind was 54,000, 137k is more than enough for the boss.

All signs point to `round_select`. It's time.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**Balatro Hand Analysis: Ante 7/8**

Alright, let's break this down. It's Round 17, and the Boss Blind, The Mouth, is demanding only one hand type this round. The good news is, I played High Card last time, and I've got a killer setup with my Jokers. My goal is 70,000 chips, and I need to make up 15,520. I've got 3 hands left and 4 discards. I'm rocking Smiley Face (+5 Mult for faces), Photograph (x2 Mult for first face card), Hanging Chad (Retrigger first played card 2 times), and Stuntman (+250 chips, +10 Mult Holo), plus Pareidolia (all cards are face cards).

My current hand has a Queen of Spades, 10 of Spades, 2 of Spades, King of Hearts, Queen of Hearts (Foil/Lucky), and 4 of Diamonds. The *key* here is that Queen of Hearts *Foil* - it's a +50 chips windfall. I can definitely make it with the Queen of Hearts!

To make a hand, I play a high card.

I need to calculate the value of the Queen of Hearts with all modifiers. It's going to be something like:

*   Chips: Base 45 + Stuntman 250 + Queen of Hearts (10 + 50) = 355
*   The Hanging Chad retriggers three times!
*   Mult: Base 5. Smiley (+5), Photograh x2, Stuntman (+10 Holo).
    *   Trigger 1: Base 5 -> 10. Then x2 (Photograph) = 20
    *   Trigger 2: 20 -> 25. Then x2 (Photograph) = 50.
    *   Trigger 3: 50 -> 55. Then x2 (Photograph) = 110.
    *   Add Stuntman Holo + 10 = 120 mult
    *   475 * 120 = 57000. That is how much I will earn.
*   Chips: Base + Stuntman (295) + Queen of Hearts (60)
    *   295 + 60 = 355.
    *   355 * 120 = 42,600.
    *   Oh, wait, the card *triggers* three times. That means: 295 + (60*3) = 475 chips. That's a huge difference!
*   (45 + 250) + (10 + 50) + (10 + 50) + (10 + 50) = 475.
    *   475 x 120 mult = 57,000 chips.
    *   I'll be way over my target.

The calculation matches my previous high card, so I'm good to go. I should have enough to make the target. I'm playing the Queen of Hearts (Position 5) as the high card. No need for any consumables (The World). Money is fine. I am going to win this round!
